title: How to Make an Organza Wreath

parts.name: Attaching the fabric to the wreath

steps.headline: Wrap the lamé fabric all the way around the wreath.
steps.description: If you need to make joins, overlap the fabric neatly and glue in place. Glue the end piece in place. When gluing, keep the fabric as flat as possible, to avoid making lumps.

steps.headline: Wrap the lamé fabric around with the organza strips.
steps.description: Again, glue any joins neatly in place and glue the end piece off neatly. Any joins and the end piece should be at the back of the wreath, so as to not show when on display.

steps.headline: Wrap the thin ribbon around the wreath.
steps.description: Leave gaps of about 5cm/2 inches between each following wrap; there should be plenty of the underlying organza and lamé fabrics showing through, as the ribbon is simply a decorative addition. As you wrap, glue the ribbon in place.

steps.headline: Make a large bow using the wire edge ribbon.
steps.description: Make a 4 to 6 loop bow, so that it appears voluminous. Tie in the middle with some of the small ribbon. Check that it looks even and make any adjustments as needed. Cut the edges in "V" shapes to prevent fraying.

steps.headline: Glue the large bow to the base of the organza wreath.
Attach small cord to the top of the wreath for hanging from.
steps.description: The wreath is now ready for hanging.

text: Attaching the fabric to the wreath Wrap the lamé fabric all the way around the wreath. If you need to make joins, overlap the fabric neatly and glue in place. Glue the end piece in place. When gluing, keep the fabric as flat as possible, to avoid making lumps. Wrap the lamé fabric around with the organza strips. Again, glue any joins neatly in place and glue the end piece off neatly. Any joins and the end piece should be at the back of the wreath, so as to not show when on display. Wrap the thin ribbon around the wreath. Leave gaps of about 5cm/2 inches between each following wrap; there should be plenty of the underlying organza and lamé fabrics showing through, as the ribbon is simply a decorative addition. As you wrap, glue the ribbon in place. Adding the finishing touches Make a large bow using the wire edge ribbon. Make a 4 to 6 loop bow, so that it appears voluminous. Tie in the middle with some of the small ribbon. Check that it looks even and make any adjustments as needed. Cut the edges in "V" shapes to prevent fraying. Glue the large bow to the base of the organza wreath.  Attach small cord to the top of the wreath for hanging from. The wreath is now ready for hanging. Finished.
